event.title: was moved to a short four-lane bypass of downtown in the late 1950s

data.event: US 206 originally passed through the center of Columbus on Atlantic Avenue and New York Avenue until it was moved to a short four-lane bypass of downtown in the late 1950s/early 1960s.

event.title: became a county-maintained road (Burlington CR 690) in 1986

data.event: The old surface route became state-maintained New Jersey Route 170 but became a county-maintained road (Burlington CR 690) in 1986.
The community was originally known as Black Horse after the tavern, a vote was held in 1795 to determine Burlington County's county seat which featured Black Horse as one of three top vote-getters.
The settlement was renamed Columbus around 1827 and was named for Christopher Columbus.
